arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner is ‘impressed’ with the evolution of Brentford
arts.sum: “Of course, I watched their last game against Liverpool because these were our next two opponents. Also, now when they play Kristoffer Ajer as a left-back, that means many tall players, and then getting the game into the final third, of course, long throw-ins, set plays.

arts.ttl: Keith Andrews enjoying life at Brentford as Bees seek fourth consecutive win away to Crystal Palace
arts.sum: "During the week is a good example of that: you go from playing Liverpool, playing the way we did, to then going to face League Two opposition in the Cup, and I think that’s a real good test of where we’re at as a football club." Keith Andrews says he is "enjoying" life as Brentford head coach as his side seek a fourth consecutive win under him when they travel to Crystal Palace on Saturday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Brentford receive triple fitness boost ahead of Palace away trip
arts.sum: Brentford head coach Keith Andrews receives a triple fitness boost ahead of Saturday's meeting with Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Premier League fixture changes for late December and early January
arts.sum: See the revised schedule as matches including Arsenal v Liverpool are moved for live TV coverage

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace vs. Brentford injury, suspension list, predicted XIs
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up all of the latest team news ahead of Saturday’s Premier League clash between Crystal Palace and Brentford.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace v Brentford team news update: Arthur, Henderson, Hickey and Yarmoliuk
arts.sum: Brentford has an issued an update on Benjamin Arthur, Jordan Henderson, Aaron Hickey and Yehor Yarmoliuk ahead of Saturday’s Premier League game against Crystal Palace (3pm kick-off GMT). Yarmoliuk was withdrawn during the first half of the west Londoners’ 3-2 win over Liverpool due to a contact injury, but he too is available for Saturday’s game against Crystal Palace.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace vs Brentford predictions: Eagles to edge out Bees
arts.sum: Elliott Bretland fancies Crystal Palace to see off Brentford when the Eagles host the Bees in the Premier League.
